A Collection in The Fairfax County Public Library

archdesc.runner: Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The 1807 Fee Book Scrapbook is a reused fee book from 1807 that contains newspaper clippings from 1872-1882 pasted over the original account writings. The newspaper clippings included are mostly poems but also obituaries and marriage announcements from the Fairfax Herald and other Northern Virginia area newspapers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1807 Fee Book Scrapbook, MSS 06-79, Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by William Page Johnson, II, January 31, 1996

bioghist.head: Historical and Biographical Information
bioghist.p: It is unclear who the creator of this scrapbook is. The book was given to William Page Johnson II, a cousin of Virginia Laughlin in 1994. Virginia (Whalen) Laughlin was the daughter of John McGill Whalen and Florence Sisson, granddaughter of John William Whalen. John McGill Whalen (1896-1945) was Clerk of the Fairfax County Circuit Court from 1936-1945. His father, John William Whalen (1862-1924), was the janitor for the Fairfax County Courthouse for many years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1807 Fee Book Scrapbook is a reused fee book from 1807 that contains newspaper clippings from 1872-1882 pasted over the original account writings. The newspaper clippings included are mostly poems but also obituaries and marriage announcements from the Fairfax Herald and other Northern Virginia area newspapers.
